H0.text: Cytoplasm or nucleus are the locations where intracellular receptor proteins are found in target cells.

H1.text: Mucus or nucleus are the locations in target cells where intracellular receptor proteins are found.

H2.text: Membrane or mitochondria are the locations within target cells where intracellular receptor proteins are found.

H3.text: Ribosomes or nucleus are the locations in target cells where intracellular receptor proteins are found.

A4.text: Examples are the class of nuclear receptors located in the cell nucleus and cytoplasm.

A5.text: Intracellular receptors are located inside the cell rather than on its cell membrane.
